{"step_by_step_thinking": "The pulp of a tooth is a living tissue that contains several structures. Collagen fibres are a part of the extracellular matrix of the pulp. Non-myelinated nerve fibres are also present in the pulp, providing sensation. Reticulum is a network of cells and fibres in the pulp. However, Haversian fibres are not found in the pulp. They are part of the Haversian system, which is found in compact bone, not in the pulp of a tooth.", "answer_choice": "B"}
